description: [Status: stable] [Name: unnecessary-list-index-lookup] [Message: List index lookup in enumerate() loop] What it does Checks for index-based list accesses during enumerate iterations. Why is this bad? When iterating over a list with enumerate, the current item is already available alongside its index. Using the index to look up the item is unnecessary. Example letters = ["a", "b", "c"] for index, letter in enumerate(letters): print(letters[index]) Use instead: letters = ["a", "b", "c"] for index, letter in enumerate(letters): print(letter)
